alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Orange; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 11:44AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A snow squall will impact portions of Orange, south central Caledonia and southern Washington Counties through 1230 PM EST... At 1143 AM EST, A snow squall was reported along a line extending from Ryegate to near Fayston. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Visibility less than a half mile. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. Locations impacted include... Barre, Bradford, Orange, Chelsea, Websterville, Corinth, Randolph, Waitsfield, Topsham, Berlin, Groton, Fairlee, West Fairlee, Barre Town, Northfield Village, Tunbridge, Vershire, Corinth Corners, Topsham Four Corners, and Washington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 29 and 50. Interstate 91 between mile markers 90 and 118.
info.instruction: Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions, especially over higher elevations. Travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
